Title: Senior Product Analyst
Description:
Who Are We?

Postman is the world’s leading API platform, used by more than 25 million developers and 500,000 organizations, including 98% of the Fortune 500. Postman is helping developers and professionals across the globe build the API-first world by simplifying each step of the API lifecycle and streamlining collaboration—enabling users to create better APIs, faster.

The company is headquartered in San Francisco and has an office in Bangalore, where it was founded. Postman is privately held, with funding from Battery Ventures, BOND, Coatue, CRV, Insight Partners, and Nexus Venture Partners. Learn more at postman.com or connect with Postman on Twitter via @getpostman.

P.S: We highly recommend reading The "API-First World" graphic novel to understand the bigger picture and our vision at Postman.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a Senior Product Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making and deliver actionable insights that will contribute to accelerating and scaling the next stage of user and ARR growth for Postman. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze data, identify trends, and provide recommendations for product improvements. Your work will directly impact our product roadmap and overall user experience.

The position will be a key partner to help drive decision making in conjunction with cross functional teams, using the broad base of customer data available in our data warehouse(s). The person in this role will be expected to generate insights from the data on a proactive basis, while also being able to design and analyze experiments meant to better understand the motivations of a diverse customer base.

Ultimately, a successful person in this role will be expected to be a resident expert in their area of the business, and can work autonomously leading analytics efforts to encourage the team to improve the customer experience and metrics.

What You’ll Do

Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights related to user behavior, product usage, and market trends.Reporting and Visualization: Create and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and communicate findings to stakeholders.A/B Testing: Plan and conduct A/B tests to assess the impact of product changes, and provide recommendations based on the results.Product Strategy: Collaborate with product managers to align data analysis with product development, helping to define and prioritize features and improvements.Data Quality: Ensure data accuracy and consistency, and work with relevant teams to resolve data quality issues.Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, design, marketing, and other teams to drive product improvements and optimize user experiences.Forecasting: Develop forecasting models to estimate future product performance and identify potential opportunities and challenges.Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior analysts and contribute to building a strong data-driven culture within the organization.

About You

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Business Analytics).4-6 years experience as a Product Analyst or similar role, with a focus on data analysis and product insights.Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R) and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).Strong understanding of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.Experience with web and mobile analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Amplitude) is a plus.Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines.Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.A passion for product development and a customer-focused mindset.Knowledge of machine learning and predictive modeling is a bonus.Prior knowledge of developer tools, with emphasis on API development (preferred).

Our Values

At Postman, we create with the same curiosity that we see in our users. We value transparency & honest communication about not only successes, but also failures. In our work, we focus on specific goals that add up to a larger vision. Our inclusive work culture ensures that everyone is valued equally as important pieces of our final product. We are dedicated to delivering the best products we can.

What Else?

This role is based in the greater San Francisco Bay area, and the reasonably estimated salary for this role ranges from $155,635 to 190,220, plus a competitive equity package. Actual compensation is based on the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition to our pay-on-performance philosophy, we offer a comprehensive set of benefits, including full medical coverage, flexible PTO, wellness reimbursement, and a monthly lunch stipend. Salaries will vary outside of the listed metropolitan areas & the U.S.

Equal Opportunity

Postman is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Postman does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Postman will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Postman.

Title: Software Product Management Analyst
Description:
Overview

Systems Planning and Analysis, Inc. (SPA) delivers high-impact, technical solutions to complex national security issues. With over 50 years of business expertise and consistent growth, we are known for continuous innovation for our government customers, in both the US and abroad. Our exceptionally talented team is highly collaborative in spirit and practice, producing Results that Matter . Come work with the best! We offer opportunity, unique challenges, and clear-sighted commitment to the mission. SPA: Objective. Responsive. Trusted.

SPA assists the Defense Threat Reduction Agency (DTRA) in developing leading edge technologies to counter WMD in support of CCMDs and transitioning these technologies to military services and COCOMs. SPA provides expertise across the full range of chemical, biological, radiological, nuclear and high-yield explosives (CBRNE) WMD, Counter Improvised Threat and Countering Threat Network technologies to support understanding, detection, identification, characterization, denial, control, disabling, defeating, disposing, safeguarding the force, managing consequences, and test and evaluation in support of military and civilian operations.

 Systems Planning and Analysis has a near term need for a Software Product Management Analyst. 

Responsibilities

The successful candidate will (1) serve as a technical/scientific resource on projects, analyzing problems and provide recommendations, technical support, and advice to the Defense Threat Reduction Agency (DTRA), Research and Development (RD) Directorate, Nuclear Technologies (NT) Department, Nuclear Detection Division and (2) conduct technical assessments, program and portfolio analysis, provide technical advisory support, and other advisory functions to support the planning, preparation, definition, and execution of S&T programs.

Works with and provides input to Program Managers (PM) to provide software program/product management oversight, particularly of several inter-operable software programs. Supports PM’s in decisions about software goals, dependencies, architectures, trade-offs, new features, and various other aspects of software products. Works with various stakeholders (e.g., users, sponsors, technology contributors, and developers) to determine product risks, opportunities, and program plans. Gathers feedback from stakeholder groups. Developing product roadmaps that integrate inputs across the stakeholder community. Act as the liaison to the software development community to ensure technical hurdles can be represented to non-developers and that program management factors can be communicated to developers.

 Travel: (10-25%) may be required. 

Qualifications

 Required Qualifications  :

 BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related field plus 2 years relevant experience  Familiarity with software product management tools such as Atlassian tools (e.g., Jira, Confluence)  Demonstrated experience analyzing program trade-offs and providing decision-support analysis  Knowledge of or experience with sensors or detectors  Demonstrated experience conducting briefing to managers and stakeholders  Demonstrated experience managing stakeholder relationships  Ability to work with common office productivity software (e.g. Microsoft Office, Skype, Windows, SharePoint)  Ability to translate requirements and observations into clearly defined written products (briefings, reports, White Papers) in short timeframes  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills  Secret security clearance with ability to acquire / maintain DoD TS/SCI clearance 

Desired Qualifications

 MS in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related field plus 2 years relevant experience  ≥ 3 years as a software project manager  Familiarity with portfolio management, including prioritization and trade-off analysis methods  Familiarity with software engineering management practices  Familiarity with machine learning, data science, and related technologies and applications  Familiarity with the DoD acquisition lifecycle  Familiarity with counter-weapons of mass destruction missions, technology, and organizations  Familiarity with combatant command (COCOM) organizations and missions  Familiarity with Microsoft 365 (including Teams, PowerBI, and use for project management)  TS/SCI security clearance

Spotter, named one of TIME100's Most Influential Companies this year, empowers top YouTube creators to accelerate their business and unleash their full creative potential by giving them access to the capital, knowledge, and community they need to succeed at scale. In this newly created position, your responsibilities will be to leverage existing and to identify – even build – new approaches to interpret, report, and contextualize the performance of advertising across Spotter content. In this role you will also prepare product research, ROI analysis and summary presentations to leadership teams used to determine the best product solutions.

So What Kind of Folks Are We Looking for?

Excellent verbal and written communication skills. The ability to talk and write with confidence, charisma and competence for a wide variety of technical and non-technical audiences including management.Plays well with others. You will be working in a high-functioning team environment. We work together in order to win together. Organization and time management skills in spades. You’ll need to ask the right questions and put pieces of the puzzle together between business and development teams.Passionate and goal-oriented.   • Develop a deep understanding of our AdTech stack, including ad serving platforms, ad formats/ delivery experiences, supply and demand dimensions, partner programming requirements, campaign scoring, budget pacing, audience management and user-level targeting capabilities.

  • Conduct A/B tests and analyze user behavior to make data-driven recommendations for improving user experience, as well as app/ad performance across our network
  • Data Analysis and Insights:
  • Dig deep. You will utilize data analytics tools to perform in-depth analysis of user engagement, ad performance, and app usage patterns across dozens of supply-side dimensions.
  • Make data accessible. You will build product performance dashboards and workbooks using data visualization tools and pivot tables to effectively communicate performance trends to stakeholders.
  • Draw Insights. You will highlight key findings, generate actionable insights, and propose optimizations/ recommendations based on data, contributing to product roadmaps and strategies.
  • Be the “SME”. You are the go-to person when someone asks questions like: “is this feature working”, “when do these events fire”, “how should we interpret this graph”, or “what does this value mean”.
  • Define “healthy”. You will help to define performance expectations and monitoring requirements for new features so that we can quickly identify when issues arise.
  • Collaboration and Communication:
  • Work closely with product managers, software developers, and UX/UI designers to drive product enhancements and feature development.
  • Assist data science with discovery, investigations and insights to steer the development of machine learning algorithms.
  • Collaborate with engineering teams to troubleshoot technical issues.
  • Effectively communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, promoting a clear understanding of product performance and potential improvements.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus.
  • Proven experience (5+ years) in product analysis, AdTech, and Android platform analysis.
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, or similar languages.
  • Strong analytical mindset with the ability to interpret complex data and derive actionable insights.
  • Natural tendency to be curious and creative
  • Familiarity with mobile application development, Android Studio, and related SDKs

Title: Product Analyst
Description:
About Us

Our mission is to become the de facto way people learn foreign languages. We begin by teaching the next billion people English and Spanish.

English is the global language of business, culture, and communication, and over 1.5 billion people around the world are actively trying to learn right now. Others dream of communicating with the half-billion native Spanish speakers across the globe. The problem is that it's nearly impossible to learn to speak a language without constant access to a speaking partner. Grammar and vocab apps don't really help – you need to actually converse with someone.

Speak is on a journey to fix this. We're creating an AI-powered experience that replicates the flow of a conversation, without needing a human on the other end. The goal is to make it radically more accessible to be able to have conversations in a foreign language and eventually help hundreds of millions of people gain fluency who otherwise wouldn't be able to.

We started on this journey over five years ago and we've still got a long ways to go. We're thoughtfully adding new team members only when we think they can truly play a big role in our mission.

Speak launched first in South Korea where we have quickly grown to become the top grossing education app in the country. We have now delivered this winning product to more than 30 countries globally and are continuing to expand to more markets in the coming months. The company is well funded, raising a recent Series B backed by investors like OpenAI, Founders Fund, Y Combinator, Khosla Ventures, Lachy Groom, Josh Buckley, and others. We’re a team of 60 based primarily in SF, Seoul, Tokyo, and Ljubljana.

About This Role

Speak is looking for a person who is passionate about and fully dedicated to learning about how users engage with our apps. This individual will be critical for helping create hypotheses and finding insights that allow the team to build a better product and grow the business. Our second product analytics hire will grow our data-driven culture at Speak by empowering team members to use data in their respective roles. In this role you will own specific verticals within analytics and testing infrastructure and be a key thought partner to leadership and the whole product development organization.

What You’ll Be Doing

Drive product strategy by proposing and conducting quantitative research into key user behaviors and trends, in partnership with product managers, engineers, designers, and other team membersDesign new features and inform the product roadmap through analysis, e.g., help define metrics for every stage of the user journey (onboarding, conversion, engagement, retention)Build and maintain core company data events and tablesBuild and maintain company-level product and business dashboardsDesign and analyze A/B tests, market-based tests, etc. and conduct other forms of causal inference to help us rigorously learn about our usersInform future experimentation design and roadmaps by performing exploratory analysis to understand user engagement behavior and derive insights

What We’re Looking For

3-5 years of experience using analytics to drive key product business decisionsSignificant experience with SQLAdvanced knowledge of visualization tools such as ModeDeep understanding of statistical analysis, experimentation design, and common analytical techniques like regression and decision treesSolid background in running multivariate product experiments to optimize a product or revenue flowProven track record of being able to work autonomously and proactively engage with business stakeholders

Why work at Speak

Join a fantastic, tight-knit team at the right time: we're growing very quickly, we've raised our Series B and an additional extension from some of the top investors in the valley, and we've achieved product-market fit in our initial markets. You'd join at a magical time when a single person could significantly change the course of the company.Do your life's work with people you’ll love working with: we care strongly about our craft and want every person at Speak to feel like they're growing every day. We believe in the idea that working with people you both enjoy and have respect for makes everything better. We hire thoughtfully and only work with people we admire deeply.Global in nature: We're live in over 40 countries and launching in a number of new markets soon. We have dedicated offices in San Francisco, Ljubljana, Seoul, and Tokyo, and you’ll have the opportunity to talk to users in each of these regions on a regular basis as well as travel.Impact people's lives in a major way: Learning a language is one of the single most life-changing skills one can learn, and right now 99% of people never achieve their goal because the process is broken. We’re helping millions of people achieve their goals and improve their lives.

Primary Responsibilities

  • With the CTO, leadership team, product managers, architects, and software developers, become the point person for the official documentation on how all business and technical processes were designed and operated. Adjustments to any business or technical roadmaps, processes, or systems start with involving the BSA to create and document the requirements for any necessary changes, including success criteria for the Quality Assurance (QA) testing team.
  • Seeks to identify and understand all business and system processes and create a complete, accurate, and current set of curated documentation describing them. Should changes occur, they must be documented and approved by the BSA and then curated.

Duties/Responsibilities

  • Requirements Gathering Play a pivotal role in defining both nonfunctional and functional requirements of all applicable systems and business processes, ensuring clarity and alignment with business goals. This involves close collaboration with stakeholders to understand their needs and translate these into actionable technical specifications for the product and development teams.
  • Documentation and Process Management: Prepare and curate comprehensive documentation, including business process flows, system requirements, and product specifications, ensuring they are accessible and understandable. Utilize documentation and project management tools such as Confluence, Jira, Figma, and others to maintain coherence across team efforts.
  • Design and Development Collaboration: Work alongside UX/UI designers, product managers and developers to ensure that product designs and functionalities align with business requirements and user expectations. Actively participate in Scrum and Agile processes to keep development efforts focused and efficient.
  • Business and Market Analysis: Conduct thorough analyses to understand market gaps, competitor solutions, and potential opportunities, adjusting project objectives and technical offerings accordingly. Collaboration with UX researchers and solution architects is crucial to assess product market potential and required functionalities.
  • Feedback and Improvement Cycles: Partner with interdepartmental team members to facilitate the collection and analysis of user feedback to identify areas for improvement.
  • Translate insights into actionable backlog items for subsequent development phases, ensuring continuous product enhancement.
  • Works with interdepartmental teams to define project scoping efforts with accuracy and efficiency, on time, and on budget.
  • Partners with teams to convert ideas into detailed roadmaps supported by curated business and technology process documentation and the transitional steps required.
  • Conducts a project cost analysis, estimating expected costs and timing for the project.
  • Conducts risk assessments; reports identified risks to management; provides recommendations for mitigation of risk (including termination of the project if necessary).
  • Acts as the “how it works” liaison between key project participants, including company team members, key stakeholders, executive leadership, customers, partners, and vendors, as needed.
  • Ensures compliance with federal, state, local, industry, contractual, and company regulations, standards, specifications, and best practices.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in a related field, which may include Computer Science, Business, or Engineering, required.
  • At least three years of proven experience as a Business Systems Analyst (BSA) within a software development environment.
  • Demonstrated success with Agile software development teams and projects.
  • Strong technical foundation, with the ability to understand and communicate complex technical concepts.
  • Proficiency in project and documentation management tools such as MS Project, Jira, Confluence, LucidChart, or similar tools.
  • Success in utilizing Atlassian Confluence to integrate product/technology documentation with development efforts documented in JIRA and other workflow solutions.
  • Demonstrated ability in resource management, project budgeting, and risk assessment.
  • Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of working effectively with cross-functional teams.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in creating Gantt and other reporting, which provides senior leaders with insights into project and larger-scale roadmap activities.
  • Certifications such as IIBA, CBAP, PMI-PBA, or similar.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong supervisory and leadership skills across diverse, multi-location teams.
  • Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.
  • Thorough understanding of or the ability to quickly learn about the project or product being developed.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software and adept at creating detailed project documentation and reports.

Other Requirements

This role leverages a flex schedule that may involve nontraditional working hours. Must be able to work from the Recall Master office or remotely from a home office, depending on the candidate’s skills and experience. This position is eligible to US citizens physically residing in the US, any offer of employment is contingent upon background, drug screen, and reference checks.

Title: Staff Product Analyst, Self Serve (Remote, Americas EST)
Description:
This is a remote position. We are looking for candidates in the Americas Eastern time zones.

About The Role

We are looking for a Staff Product Analyst who can lead our product analytics function, from guiding the implementation of product analytics tooling (e.g., FullStory, Rudderstack, etc.) to strategy and roadmap prioritization/development. Grafana has recently launched a number of new products, many of which we recently unveiled at ObservabilityCON 2023 (e.g., Asserts, App O11y, Frontend O11y, Beyla) - as a result we’re really looking to ramp up our product analytics capabilities, particularly focused around these new product areas.

This role will partner closely with our PM, UX, and Engineering departments and report to our Director of Analytics. You will be joining a relatively small, but growing, data team - 3 analysts and 1 data engineer - so we often lean into being scrappy - finding the highest leverage areas of impact, punching above our weight, and over-indexing toward a bias for action.

You Will

Partner cross functionally across Product to establish top-level KPIs, dashboards, and product roadmap planningGuide the instrumentation of product data in collaboration with our PMs, UX, and Engineering teamsPlay a key role in the implementation of our product analytics tooling (e.g., Rudderstack, FullStory) and product A/B testingDevelop dbt models to transform and test our product data in partnership with our Analytics Engineering teamWork with our product leaders and FP&A to establish departmental goals and revenue targets


You have

Experience partnering across product and engineering organizations, and familiarity with typical product KPIs and frameworks (e.g., DAU/MAU, funnels, A/B testing)SQL: writing complex yet efficient SQL is a daily habit for youData Visualization: experience with any of the following tools Tableau, Looker, Hex, or of course, Grafana!Experience writing dbt models, and implementing product analytics tooling (e.g., Heap, Pendo, Amplitude, FullStory)Excellent communication skills, able to explain technical topics to non-technical audiences, and maintain many of the essential cross-team and cross-functional relationships necessary for the team’s success


A plus if you have

Knowledge about observabilityFamiliarity with Airflow or Prefect - generating ad hoc ETL jobs


In the United States, the Base compensation range for this role is $152,000 - $183,000. Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed in the interview process. Benefits include equity, bonus (if applicable) and other benefits listed here

About Grafana Labs: There are more than 950,000 active installations of Grafana around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps companies including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay manage their observability strategies with full-stack offerings that can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud, or self-managed with Grafana Enterprise Stack. The Grafana stack has grown to include four other open source projects, Grafana Loki (for logs), Grafana Tempo (for traces), Grafana Mimir (for metrics), and Grafana OnCall (for on-call management).

Benefits: For more information about the perks and benefits of working at Grafana, please check out our careers page.

We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organisation and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organisation as we grow.

Title: Public Policy Analyst, Product
Description:
As a product policy analyst, you will support our product offerings with a public policy perspective, serving as a bridge between our product team and the policy community. You will work cross functionally to monitor and comply with global regulations; create written materials outlining our responsible product approach (e.g.,policy briefs, white papers and government filings); and support product deployment. The role is highly cross functional and requires an ability to take initiative, work with diverse internal and external stakeholders, and execute in a fast paced environment on our highest priorities.

About Anthropic

Anthropic is an AI safety and research company that’s working to build reliable, interpretable, and steerable AI systems. We want AI to be safe and beneficial for our customers and for society as a whole. Our interdisciplinary team has experience across ML, physics, policy, business and product.

Representative Projects:

Ensure product compliance with priority policies, regulatory proposals, and guidelines in key global marketsDevelop and publish policy papers, consultation responses, and other written materials articulating Anthropic’s approach to responsible product development and advancing our product policy positionsShape and advance product policy positions (e.g., competition, risk management practices)Support policy partnerships and collaborations with governments, nonprofits, and/or academics to advance the use of product/Claude for socially beneficial uses Engage with key policy stakeholders (e.g., via briefings, consultations, demos, roundtables, or by supporting senior-level engagements) to demonstrate Anthropic’s responsible product development, share latest product research, and build/maintain trust

You might be a good fit if you:

Have 5+ years public policy experience in tech, government, or bothAre adept at working with diverse cross functional teams (including but not limited to trust and safety, legal, product, research, comms, and marketing)Are experienced in designing and advocating for concrete policy and regulatory proposals for consumer and/or enterprise tech productsExperience briefing policymakers and government officialsAre an exceptional written and verbal communication communicatorAre an eager learner who enjoys thinking through policy and product implications of technical developments and industry trendsHave the ability work independently and adeptly in fast moving dynamic environmentsHave demonstrated interest and experience in a complicated technical subject (ideally, AI, but other examples could be quantum computing, advanced cryptography, fusion power, etc)

Strong candidates may also:

Have direct experience working in product policy (e.g. trust and safety, public policy, or related role/team)Have experience in AI/ML (generative AI a bonus)Have expertise in copyright, privacy, competition or other related tech policy areaHave experience developing and executing partnership(s) with civil society, academia, and/or government

Annual Salary (USD)

The expected salary range for this position is $230,000 - $260,000. 

We encourage you to apply even if you do not believe you meet every single qualification. Not all strong candidates will meet every single qualification as listed. Research shows that people who identify as being from underrepresented groups are more prone to experiencing imposter syndrome and doubting the strength of their candidacy, so we urge you not to exclude yourself prematurely and to submit an application if you're interested in this work. We think AI systems like the ones we're building have enormous social and ethical implications. We think this makes representation even more important, and we strive to include a range of diverse perspectives on our team.

Compensation and Benefits*

Anthropic’s compensation package consists of three elements: salary, equity, and benefits. We are committed to pay fairness and aim for these three elements collectively to be highly competitive with market rates.

Equity - On top of this position's salary (listed above), equity will be a major component of the total compensation. We aim to offer higher-than-average equity compensation for a company of our size, and communicate equity amounts at the time of offer issuance.

US Benefits - The following benefits are for our US-based employees:

 Optional equity donation matching at a 3:1 ratio, up to 50% of your equity grant.  Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance for you and all your dependents.  401(k) plan with 4% matching.  22 weeks of paid parental leave.  Unlimited PTO – most staff take between 4-6 weeks each year, sometimes more! Stipends for education, home office improvements, commuting, and wellness.  Fertility benefits via Carrot.  Daily lunches and snacks in our office.  Relocation support for those moving to the Bay Area. 

UK Benefits - The following benefits are for our UK-based employees:

 Optional equity donation matching at a 3:1 ratio, up to 50% of your equity grant.  Private health, dental, and vision insurance for you and your dependents.  Pension contribution (matching 4% of your salary).  22 weeks of paid parental leave.  Unlimited PTO – most staff take between 4-6 weeks each year, sometimes more! Health cash plan.  Life insurance and income protection.  Daily lunches and snacks in our office.  This compensation and benefits information is based on Anthropic’s good faith estimate for this position as of the date of publication and may be modified in the future. Employees based outside of the UK or US will receive a different benefits package. The level of pay within the range will depend on a variety of job-related factors, including where you place on our internal performance ladders, which is based on factors including past work experience, relevant education, and performance on our interviews or in a work trial. 

How We're Different

We believe that the highest-impact AI research will be big science. At Anthropic we work as a single cohesive team on just a few large-scale research efforts. And we value impact — advancing our long-term goals of steerable, trustworthy AI — rather than work on smaller and more specific puzzles. We view AI research as an empirical science, which has as much in common with physics and biology as with traditional efforts in computer science. We're an extremely collaborative group, and we host frequent research discussions to ensure that we are pursuing the highest-impact work at any given time. As such, we greatly value communication skills. We do not have boundaries between engineering and research, and we expect all of our technical staff to contribute to both as needed.

The easiest way to understand our research directions is to read our recent research . This research continues many of the directions our team worked on prior to Anthropic, including: GPT-3 , Circuit-Based Interpretability , Multimodal Neurons , Scaling Laws , AI & Compute , Concrete Problems in AI Safety , and Learning from Human Preferences .

Come work with us!

Anthropic is a public benefit corporation based in San Francisco. We offer competitive compensation and benefits, optional equity donation matching, generous vacation and parental leave, flexible working hours, and a lovely office space in which to collaborate with colleagues.
